intro: Phaleria platyphylla, commonly known as the flat-leafed phaleria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and fragrant, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Its growth habit includes a shrub or small tree form, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters.
